page.title: List of Irish counties' coats of arms

rev.comment: rm non-free images in list article per [[WP:NFLISTS]]

Line 90: Line 90:
| [[Image:Kerrycocologo.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Kerry|Kerry]] || Per fess vert and or a fess indented point in point argent and azure between in chief an antique crown of the second between two cross crosslets fitchÃ©e of the third and in base a representation of the boat of St. Brendan of the first, with the motto: ''Comhar, Cabhair, Cairdeas'' (Co-operation, Help, Friendship).<br/> Granted 12 April 1984.<ref name=register/>
| [[Image:Kerrycocologo.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Kerry|Kerry]] || Per fess vert and or a fess indented point in point argent and azure between in chief an antique crown of the second between two cross crosslets fitchÃ©e of the third and in base a representation of the boat of St. Brendan of the first, with the motto: ''Comhar, Cabhair, Cairdeas'' (Co-operation, Help, Friendship).<br/> Granted 12 April 1984.<ref name=register/>

| [[Image:County_Limerick_Council.JPG|100px|border]] || [[County Limerick|Limerick]] || Vert three pallets wavy argent, a cross patÃ©e convexed within an annulet Or, with the crest: A figure of [[Patrick Sarsfield]], the right hand grasping a sword, the left hand outstretched and pointing, all proper and with the motto: ''Cuimhnigh ar Luimneach'' (Remember Limerick).<br/> Certified 24 May 1976.
+
| <!-- Do NOT place a non-free image here --> || [[County Limerick|Limerick]] || Vert three pallets wavy argent, a cross patÃ©e convexed within an annulet Or, with the crest: A figure of [[Patrick Sarsfield]], the right hand grasping a sword, the left hand outstretched and pointing, all proper and with the motto: ''Cuimhnigh ar Luimneach'' (Remember Limerick).<br/> Certified 24 May 1976.

| [[Image:IRL county Tipperary COA.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tipperary]] || Ermine a fesse quarterly 1 and 4 Or a chief indented azure 2 and 3 gules three covered cups gold.<br> Recorded as Arms of County Tipperary c.1665.<ref name=carney/> <br> These arms became obsolete when the county was divided in 1838.
| [[Image:IRL county Tipperary COA.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tipperary]] || Ermine a fesse quarterly 1 and 4 Or a chief indented azure 2 and 3 gules three covered cups gold.<br> Recorded as Arms of County Tipperary c.1665.<ref name=carney/> <br> These arms became obsolete when the county was divided in 1838.
Line 123: Line 123:
| [[File:Lderry co arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Londonderry|Londonderry]] (NI) || Per chevron Gules and Or, in chief a flax flower proper between two garbs of the second, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e couped at the wrist of the first; the shield ensigned with a mural crown gold. Supporters: On either side a sea dragon argent, each charged on the wing with a cross Gules and wreathed about the neck with a garland of oak stalked and leaved and fructed proper. Motto: ''Auxilium A Domino'' (Help comes from the Lord).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 1 February 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
| [[File:Lderry co arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Londonderry|Londonderry]] (NI) || Per chevron Gules and Or, in chief a flax flower proper between two garbs of the second, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e couped at the wrist of the first; the shield ensigned with a mural crown gold. Supporters: On either side a sea dragon argent, each charged on the wing with a cross Gules and wreathed about the neck with a garland of oak stalked and leaved and fructed proper. Motto: ''Auxilium A Domino'' (Help comes from the Lord).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 1 February 1951.<ref name=briggs/>

| [[File:Co Monaghan arms.jpg|100px|border]] || [[County Monaghan|Monaghan]] || Per pale azure and argent, in the dexter an ancient Irish shield or and in the sinister a horseâs head erased sable; on a chief per pale of the second and of the first, in the dexter a sword in bend sinister point upwards proper and in the sinister an ancient Irish drinking cup of the third and with the Motto: ''DÃºthracht agus DÃ­cheall'' (Diligence and Best Endeavour).<br/> Granted by chief Herald 10 January 1984.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do NOT place a non-free image here --> || [[County Monaghan|Monaghan]] || Per pale azure and argent, in the dexter an ancient Irish shield or and in the sinister a horseâs head erased sable; on a chief per pale of the second and of the first, in the dexter a sword in bend sinister point upwards proper and in the sinister an ancient Irish drinking cup of the third and with the Motto: ''DÃºthracht agus DÃ­cheall'' (Diligence and Best Endeavour).<br/> Granted by chief Herald 10 January 1984.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:Tyrone arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tyrone|Tyrone]] (NI) || Per fesse indented Sable and Argent, in chief a mullet of eight points of the second charged with a fleur-de-lys of the first, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e Gules. Crest: On a wreath Argent and Gules, On a mount and in front of a castle of two towers, a hurst, issuant from the battlements of the castle a dexter arm embowed in armour, the hand grasping a sword in bend sinister, all proper. Supporters: On either side a lion rampant, that to the dexter Or gorged with a ribbon, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Argent charged with a cross Gules, and that to the sinister Gules gorged with a ribbon Argent, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Azure charged with a saltire also Argent. Motto: ''Consilio et Prudentia'' (By Wisdom and Prudence).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 24 May 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
| [[File:Tyrone arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tyrone|Tyrone]] (NI) || Per fesse indented Sable and Argent, in chief a mullet of eight points of the second charged with a fleur-de-lys of the first, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e Gules. Crest: On a wreath Argent and Gules, On a mount and in front of a castle of two towers, a hurst, issuant from the battlements of the castle a dexter arm embowed in armour, the hand grasping a sword in bend sinister, all proper. Supporters: On either side a lion rampant, that to the dexter Or gorged with a ribbon, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Argent charged with a cross Gules, and that to the sinister Gules gorged with a ribbon Argent, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Azure charged with a saltire also Argent. Motto: ''Consilio et Prudentia'' (By Wisdom and Prudence).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 24 May 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
